intro: Anil lespedezioides var. simplicifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, simple leaves and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky or sandy soils. It has a low-growing habit and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. This species is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands.
